description.narrative: By 2017, a mechanism for monitoring and reporting on the six grave violations of children's rights is in place and operational., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The capacity of institutional and non-institutional protection actors is enhanced at the national and regional levels to enable them to provide gender-sensitive medical, psychosocial, legal, and livelihoods support and life skills training to vulnerable and sexually abused women and girls.

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Children associated with armed forces and armed groups - prevention and response
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, a mechanism for monitoring and reporting on the six grave violations of children's rights is in place and operational.

description.narrative: A CTFMRM is functional both at national and subnational level. Three GHNs were submitted to the SRSG CAAC office in New York. The fourth one will be sent by 31 January 2018. 423 incidents of grave violations against children, affecting 431 children (222 girls) were recorded through MRM in 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2016
